repnme.cdata!:
Georgia - First, Second, and Third
            Development Policy Operation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First, Second, and Third
            Development Policy Loan Project for Georgia were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: the strong focus of the Government on
            outcomes was vital in driving implementation of the reform
            agenda. The authorities were sharply focused on achieving
            specific development outcomes and the Development Policy
            Operations (DPO) team supported the authorities in
            developing a detailed set of monitorable outcome indicators
            to track results from implementation of the reform program.
            The focus on results and outcomes not only helped track
            implementation, but also helped to more sharply define and
            formulate the reform triggers necessary for achievement of
            the desired results. The set of monitorable indicators went
            beyond specifying end-program status and value targets by
            specifying intermediate target values for each operation.
            This helped track the pace of achievement of results along
            the course of the programmatic series. The programmatic
            approach afforded important flexibility to advance and
            deepen reform implementation in several areas and reduce the
            scope of or provide additional time for implementation in
            other areas. This approach allowed the program to maintain
            its relevance to country circumstances, reinforced
            government ownership, and contributed to a strong
            relationship of trust between the Bank and the Government.
            The flexibility was particularly appropriate in light of the
            Government's sharp focus on achieving results, which
            allowed the Bank to be flexible in supporting the path
            followed in arriving at the desired results.

repnme.cdata!:
Georgia - Strengthening public finances,
            the social safety net, and competitiveness

abstracts.cdata!:
This Report Profile tells us about
            strengthening public finances, the social safety net, and
            competitiveness in Georgia. In 2008–09, Georgia was hit with
            the dual shocks of the August 2008 conflict with Russia and
            the global financial crisis. The authorities were faced with
            the dual challenges of mitigating the impact of the economic
            downturn in the short term, and facilitating recovery and
            preparing Georgia for post-crisis growth in the medium term.
            The Development Policy Operations (DPO) series was formed by
            World Bank which supported a macroeconomic and fiscal
            framework to restore confidence and mitigate the downturn in
            2009, followed by quality fiscal adjustment to safeguard
            sustainability as economic recovery took hold in 2010–11.
            The social safety net was strengthened to support poor and
            vulnerable segments of the population during difficult
            economic times. The DPO -supported reforms provided
            financial and medical aid to thousands of poor and
            vulnerable Georgians while the economy regained its footing.
            Around 440,000 people received targeted social assistance in
            2011 and roughly 900,000 people received targeted medical
            insurance. The reforms have also bolstered investor
            confidence and improved competitiveness by reducing business
            costs and making it faster and easier to move goods in and
            out of Georgia.

repnme.cdata!:
Georgia - Expanding health insurance
            coverage and access to quality

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            expanding health insurance coverage and access to quality
            health care in Georgia. The government of Georgia strived to
            improve the performance of the health system. The Health
            Development Project extended technical and financial
            assistance to the health sector of rural areas. The priority
            was given to strengthen the primary health care system,
            particularly in rural areas. Medical Insurance Program had
            to be improved to ensure the poorest Georgians to have
            access to health care services. Georgia implemented
            far-reaching policy and institutional reforms to expand
            health insurance coverage to more than 1 million.  The
            project strengthened the organization and delivery of
            primary health care services in rural areas, and improved
            the health status of the population.

repnme.cdata!:
Georgia - Second Development Policy
            Operation Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Development Policy Operation
            (DPO 2) Program is the second in a series of three
            programmatic development policy operations intended to
            support the Government of Georgia's policy reform
            program to: (i) mitigate the impact of the economic downturn
            in the short-term; and (ii) facilitate recovery and prepare
            Georgia for post-crisis growth in the medium-term. In
            addition to a satisfactory macroeconomic and fiscal
            framework, the main policy areas supported are: (i)
            improving the efficiency and effectiveness of public
            finances; (ii) improving the effectiveness of the social
            safety net; and (iii) improving external competitiveness.
            The DPO-2 is supporting an orderly transition in the focus
            of the authorities from immediate mitigating measures toward
            preparing the conditions for post-crisis growth. Toward
            addressing the dual challenges facing Georgia, the DPO
            program supports a satisfactory macroeconomic and fiscal
            framework and key reforms in three policy areas.
